byline.contributor: María Eugenia Díaz reported from Caracas, and Nicholas Casey from Mexico City. Patricia Torres contributed reporting from Caracas.
byline.original: By MARÍA EUGENIA DÍAZ and NICHOLAS CASEY

abstract: Venezuelan Pres Nicolas Maduro increases gas prices over 1,300 percent in first major increase since 1995; price hike, coinciding with currency devaluation, stokes fears of inflation; some say both changes will be too little, too late to help nation's ailing economy.
lead_paragraph: While the price, about 10 cents per liter, is still far below world rates, for drivers here it is an essential shift from paying basically nothing.

headline.main: Price of Gas Skyrockets in Venezuela (to 38 Cents a Gallon)
headline.print_headline: Price of Gas in Venezuela Skyrockets (to 38¢ a Gallon)

snippet: While the price, about 10 cents per liter, is still far below world rates, for drivers here it is an essential shift from paying basically nothing.
